title: Masterchef's Gregg Wallace shows off his insanely ripped upper body
text:
How much longer before the abs of steel appear?(Picture: Rex; Gregg Wallace/Instagram)

Masterchef judge Gregg Wallace showed off his insane body transformation after vowing to sort out his health and fitness regime back in 2017.

The 55-year-old tensed his arm muscles and upper back to show his fans his amazing progress.

He captioned the photo: ‘Happy With This. My PT @iamdannyrai’, complimenting his personal trainer for helping him achieve his fitness goals.

Gregg has been keeping a public record of his body’s change since his promise in 2017 and it has been enough motivation for any fan to change up their lifestyles.

Fans were quick to compliment the chef on his progress, with many relating to the amount of effort that goes into a healthy lifestyle.

One fan wrote: ‘What a transformation fella. As an ex city broker who was eating and drinking whatever he wanted weighing somewhere in there region of 16st now down to 13st and running a gym and no longer trading and eating the right foods I know the work you’re putting in.

‘Not only good for the body but for the mind too. Keep it up geez. Bet the missus can’t keep her hands off ya you stallion’.

Gregg has been improving his health and fitness since 2017 (Picture: Gregg Wallace/Instagram)

There has been a huge change already (Picture: Nils Jorgensen/REX)

Fellow chef Marcus Wareing, who has a Michelin-starred restaurant and judges on MasterChef, couldn’t help but joke about Gregg’s belly.

‘Looking good from the back Gregg it’s the front bit you need to worry about..,’ he wrote along with several laughing face emojis and arm flexing emojis.

Last month, Gregg had revealed he has a body fat percentage of just 18 per cent and was down to 12 stone.

The fact that he cooks and samples great food and managed to have that little fat is already an accomplishment of its own.

His efforts have also been inspiring others watching the change.

One user commented: ‘Mate you are two years older than me. You have definitely inspired me to get off my more than substantial arse and do something,’ along with several clapping emojis.

We can’t wait to see what he looks like when he reaches his goals.
